intro: Galactites australis, commonly known as the Australian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It is known for its milky sap, which contains toxic compounds. Galactites australis is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting well to dry conditions.
